snippet: Al Blackman, 86, has been an airplane mechanic for American Airlines since age 16, and his years of service were celebrated with a flight around New York in a restored DC-3 on Wednesday.
abstract: Al Blackman's seven decades of service as an airplane mechanic for American Airlines is celebrated with a flight around New York in a restored DC-3, a plane flown by the airline between 1936 and 1947.
lead_paragraph: Al Blackman, 86, has been an airplane mechanic for American Airlines since age 16, and his years of service were celebrated with a flight around New York in a restored DC-3 on Wednesday.

headline.seo: American Airlines Celebrates Mechanic’s 70 Years of Service
headline.main: A Stroll in the Sky, After a Lifetime in the Hangar
headline.print_headline: A Lifetime In a Hangar, Then a Stroll In the Sky
